In rerun::external::eframe::egui

Module rerun::external::eframe::egui::containers

Expand description

Containers are pieces of the UI which wraps other pieces of UI. Examples: Window, ScrollArea, Resize, SidePanel, etc.

For instance, a Frame adds a frame and background to some contained UI.

Modules§

  • collapsing_header
  • frame
    Frame container
  • modal
  • panel
    Panels are Ui regions taking up e.g. the left side of a Ui or screen.
  • popup
    Show popup windows, tooltips, context menus etc.
  • scroll_area

Structs§

  • Area
    An area on the screen that can be moved by dragging.
  • AreaState
    State of an Area that is persisted between frames.
  • CentralPanel
    A panel that covers the remainder of the screen, i.e. whatever area is left after adding other panels.
  • CollapsingHeader
    A header which can be collapsed/expanded, revealing a contained Ui region.
  • CollapsingResponse
    The response from showing a CollapsingHeader.
  • ComboBox
    A drop-down selection menu with a descriptive label.
  • Frame
    A frame around some content, including margin, colors, etc.
  • Modal
    A modal dialog. Similar to a crate::Window but centered and with a backdrop that blocks input to the rest of the UI.
  • ModalResponse
    The response of a modal dialog.
  • Resize
    A region that can be resized by dragging the bottom right corner.
  • Scene
    A container that allows you to zoom and pan.
  • ScrollArea
    Add vertical and/or horizontal scrolling to a contained Ui.
  • SidePanel
    A panel that covers the entire left or right side of a Ui or screen.
  • Sides
    Put some widgets on the left and right sides of a ui.
  • TopBottomPanel
    A panel that covers the entire top or bottom of a Ui or screen.
  • Window
    Builder for a floating window which can be dragged, closed, collapsed, resized and scrolled (off by default).

Enums§

  • AboveOrBelow
    Indicate whether a popup will be shown above or below the box.
  • PopupCloseBehavior
    Determines popup’s close behavior
